definition.title: What is Tubal Ligation?
definition.content: Tubal ligation, also known as 'tubectomy' or 'tubes tied,' is a surgical procedure for women who want permanent birth control. During the procedure, the fallopian tubes are sealed, preventing the eggs from traveling down the tubes and sperm from reaching the eggs. Latest techniques, such as laparoscopic tubal ligation, offer a minimally invasive approach compared to traditional methods.

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Tubal ligation is a permanent form of birth control, and there are several techniques available for the procedure. Modern approaches, such as laparoscopic or hysteroscopic tubal ligation, offer less invasive alternatives to traditional methods.
